columns.text: The goal of this task is to calculate the net advantage of leasing for lease from the lessor’s viewpoint.

Now, we found the **Net Present Value** of the lessor, $\mathrm{NPV}_{\text {Lessor }}$, by discounting the cash flows back to the present at the lessor aftertax borrowing rate of $8\%\times(1-21\%)=6.32\%$ as follows: let's take $\begin{aligned} \mathrm{NPV}_{\text {Lessor }} &=R_{0}+\sum_{t=1}^{4} \frac{R_{t}}{(1+i)^{t}} \\ &=-\$ 4,800,000+\$1,381,700 \sum_{t=1}^{4} \frac{1}{(1+0.0632)^{t}} \\[10pt] &=-\$ 4,800,000+\$ 1,381,700 \times\left(\frac{1-\frac{1}{1.0632^{4}}}{0.0632}\right) \\[10pt] &=\boxed{-\$ 47,138.11} \end{aligned}$ ***This $\mathbf{NPV}$ we have computed here is the Net Advantage to Leasing $(\mathbf{NAL})$ for the lessor’s viewpoint***.
